TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebScriptEnablingBehavior extends System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior
Public NotInheritable Class WebScriptEnablingBehavior Inherits WebHttpBehavior

Docs.summary: Provides support for the behavior that enables Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) endpoints to receive HTTP requests from a browser-based ASP.NET AJAX client. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When applied to an endpoint, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> behavior enables WCF and ASP.NET AJAX integration, except for the support required for JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) encoding. Various types of encoding, including JSON, are enabled by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebMessageEncodingElement> or by an appropriately configured <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> behavior implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> and inherits from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior>, which enables the more general Web programming model for WCF services exposing non-SOAP endpoints.
Specifically, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior>:
- Enables the HTTP programming model, including dispatch to operations based on a URL suffix, support for HTTP verb selection (POST or GET) and HTTP cache duration control. For more information about the HTTP programming model, see [WCF Web HTTP Programming Model Overview](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-web-http-programming-model-overview). Note that the default HTTP verb is POST when using this behavior.
- Enables the correct formatter for each operation's request and response messages - for example, support for URL parameters.
- Enables the JavaScript Proxy endpoint.
To call a WCF service from an ASP.NET AJAX client, the service must be configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> binding and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior> must be added to the endpoint behavior collection. This can be done either in configuration by adding the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebScriptEnablingElement> or without using configuration by activating the AJAX endpoint with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.WebScriptServiceHostFactory> instead of the default factory in the [@ServiceHost](/dotnet/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf-directive/servicehost) directive in the .svc file.
For more information about different ways to enable a WCF service to respond to ASP.NET AJAX clients, see [Creating WCF Services for ASP.NET AJAX](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/creating-wcf-services-for-aspnet-ajax).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultBodyStyle%2A> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value.
Sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultOutgoingRequestFormat%2A> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebScriptEnablingBehavior.DefaultOutgoingResponseFormat%2A> to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior.ApplyClientBehavior%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%2CSystem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime%29> method to view, modify, or add custom extension to the client runtime across all messages used with an endpoint or for specific operations.

Docs.summary: Applies the behavior to the service endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Normally, this method is called by Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) automatically when the behavior is applied to an endpoint. So there is no need to call this method manually.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default message body style.
Docs.value: The value. This default value is the only valid value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.WrappedRequest> value is the only <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle> supported and setting any other value results in a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> being thrown.

Docs.exception: The body style set is not supported.

override this.Validate : System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint -> unit

Docs.summary: Confirms that the endpoint meets the requirements that allow it to function as an ASP.NET AJAX endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Verifies that the endpoint is not `null`, uses the HTTP or HTTPS schemes, does not use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>, uses either the HTTP GET or POST verb, that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> of the binding is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.None%2A>, and that the binding contains a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement> where <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement.ManualAddressing%2A> is set to `true`. This method also checks that there are no SOAP headers or wrapper names on the methods, or other unsupported aspects of the operations.

Docs.exception: The endpoint does not meet one of the requirements for being an ASP.NET AJAX endpoint.
